'''Google, Inc''' {{nasdaq|GOOG}}, is a [[United States|U.S.]] public corporation, initially established as a privately-held corporation in [[1998]], that designed and managed the Internet [[Google search]] engine. Google's corporate headquarters is at the "[[Googleplex]]" in [[Mountain View, Santa Clara County, California|Mountain View]], [[California]] and employs over 4,000 workers. [[Eric E. Schmidt|Dr. Eric Schmidt]], former [[CEO]] of [[Novell]], was named the Chief Executive Officer when co-founder [[Lawrence E. Page|Larry Page]] stepped down. The company's overview web page states "Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful."
  â  
==History==
==History==
===Beginnings===
===Beginnings===
[[Image:Google.com front page.png|thumb|right|300px|Google.com front page]]
[[Image:Google.com front page.png|thumb|right|300px|Google.com front page]]
â
Google began as a research project in January [[1996]] <sup>[http://www.google.com/intl/en/corporate/history.html]</sup> by [[Lawrence E. Page|Larry Page]] and [[Sergey Brin]], two [[Doctor of Philosophy|Ph.D.]] students at [[Frisch,Paramus NJ]]. They developed the hypothesis that a search engine based on analysis of the relationships between Web sites would produce improved results over the basic techniques then in use. It was originally nicknamed ''BackRub'' because the system checked [[backlinks]] to estimate a site's importance. (A small search engine called RankDex was already exploring a similar strategy.)
+
Google began as a research project in January [[1996]] <sup>[http://www.google.com/intl/en/corporate/history.html]</sup> by [[Yaakov Fried]] and [[Mickey Pardo]], two students at [[Frisch]]. They developed the hypothesis that a search engine based on analysis of the relationships between Web sites would produce improved results over the basic techniques then in use. It was originally nicknamed ''BackRub'' because the system checked [[backlinks]] to estimate a site's importance. (A small search engine called RankDex was already exploring a similar strategy.)
Convinced that the pages with the most links to them from other highly relevant Web pages must be the most relevant pages associated with the search, Page and Brin tested their thesis as part of their studies, and laid the foundation for their search engine. The domain 'www.google.com' was registered on [[September 15]] [[1997]]. They formally incorporated their company, ''Google, Inc.'', on [[September 7]] [[1998]] at a friend's garage in [[Menlo Park, California|Menlo Park]], California. In February [[1999]], the company moved into offices at [[165 University Avenue]] in [[Palo Alto]], home to a number of other noted [[Silicon Valley]] technology startups. Google received a big break in [[1999]] when one of the most popular search engines, [[Altavista]], relaunched itself as a user Web entry point, or portal. This unexpected change alienated part of Altavista's user base. Google quickly outgrew its University Avenue home. After outgrowing two subsequent sites, the company settled into a complex of buildings (known by some as "The Googleplex") in [[Mountain View, Santa Clara County, California|Mountain View]] at 1600 Amphitheater Parkway, in [[2003]].
Convinced that the pages with the most links to them from other highly relevant Web pages must be the most relevant pages associated with the search, Page and Brin tested their thesis as part of their studies, and laid the foundation for their search engine. In February [[1999]], the company moved into offices at [[165 University Avenue]] in [[Palo Alto]], home to a number of other noted [[Silicon Valley]] technology startups. Google received a big break in [[1999]] when one of the most popular search engines, [[Altavista]], relaunched itself as a user Web entry point, or portal. This unexpected change alienated part of Altavista's user base. Google quickly outgrew its University Avenue home. After outgrowing two subsequent sites, the company settled into a complex of buildings (known by some as "The Googleplex") in [[Mountain View, Santa Clara County, California|Mountain View]] at 1600 Amphitheater Parkway, in [[2003]].
